alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 26 at 5:52AM MDT until June 26 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THROUGH 8 PM MDT FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, AND UPPER RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND LOWER CHAMA RIVER VALLEY DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, AND NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WIND AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Strengthening southwest flow across northwestern New Mexico in advance of a slow moving Pacific low will combine with an extremely dry and unstable atmosphere to produce critical fire weather conditions both Monday and Tuesday. The strongest winds are expected Tuesday, when isolated, gusty, and dry thunderstorms are also forecast with areas of extreme fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), North Central Mountains (Zone 120), and the West Central Mountains (Zone 105) Monday and Tuesday afternoons through evenings. Dry thunderstorms will favor locations along and east of the continental divide on Tuesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 15 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph on Monday. Southwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 45 mph on Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 11 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning and Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains
